section.title: Permissions of proxy files
section.para: Since Java does not provide API for setting permissions of a file, the Java CoG Kit will attempt to execute /bin/chmod program in the background to set the permission of the given file. If that program cannot be executed for any reason or fails to execute, a proxy file might end up with incorrect file permissions (depending on umask setting). Usually a warning will be displayed if that occurs (especially on Windows since /bin/chmod is not supported on that platform).
